text: Snake case (or snake_case) is the process of writing compound words so that the words are separated with an underscore symbol (_) instead of a space. The first letter is usually changed to lowercase. Some examples of Snake case would be "foo_bar" or "hello_world". It is commonly used in computer code. At least one study found that readers can recognize snake case faster than CamelCase. == Variants == If the first letter of each word is uppercase, this is known as Train-Case. == Programming languages that use snake case == * OCaml * C++ * Erlang * Perl * PHP * Python * R * Ruby * Rust == Related pages == * CamelCase ==References== Category:Programming languages Category:Typography
title: Snake case
